name: Potpourri of Trivia Knowledge Online Trivia | Mixed 15 Questions | 15 Questions

questions.text: What were the names of Mr. and Mrs. Banks' children in 'Mary Poppins'(1964)?
Where were the 2004 Summer Olympic Games held?
Which seaport in India has an official name of Mumbai?
What was the middle name of Robert Stroud, 'The Birdman of Alcatraz'?
What did Winston Churchill, Oliver Cromwell, Elizabeth I, Henry VIII, Napoleon and William the Conqueror all have in common?

Which stone below was formerly classified as a 'precious' stone, along with diamond, emerald, and ruby? The other choices were formerly termed 'semi-precious', although now the division is no longer made. The 'precious' stone was...?
A dentist's amalgam, used to fill teeth, contains what percent of mercury, a poisonous, silvery element?
questions.explanation:
70 Percent.

	Don't panic, Mercuric compounds are use in pharmaceuticals too.

questions.text: Who has a child called Sage Moonblood?

Who is the American painter, sculptor and graphic artist, who is now regarded as a leading exponent of Pop Art and whose paintings include 'Whaam!' (1963) and 'Good Morning, Darling' (1964)? His name is Roy ... ?
How did English novelist Virginia Woolf die in 1941?
Cupronickel used for some silver coinage contains a percentage of copper, a percentage of nickel and a percentage of which other element?
questions.explanation:
Zinc.

	Not all cupronickel coins contain zinc, and percentages vary.

questions.text: What was the name of King George V's horse that fatally trampled suffragette Emily Davison in the 1913 Derby?
What was American pilot Kenneth Arnold the first person to see and give a name to?
Which has NOT been the name of a Pope since 1000 A.D.?
questions.explanation:
Peter the Second.

	Sylvester the Second 999-1003, Urban the Second 1088-99, Paul the Second 1464-71

questions.text: What is the middle name of record producer Quincy Jones who produced Michael Jackson's first solo album 'Off the Wall' and the best selling album of all time, 'Thriller'?
